programme.desc: Investigating the murder of a brilliant professor.

programme.desc: When a determined investigator works with a prosecutor in hope of solving a 20-year-old murder case, a dark secret is uncovered.

programme.desc: Years after a Montana man is found dead, his son opens up a box of case files to find out what really happened.

programme.desc: When a mother of four dies unexpectedly on Valentine's Day, her death is attributed to natural causes, but a detective suspects that someone murdered the woman.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: During the matchup between the New Orleans Saints and the Minnesota Vikings, a last-minute 61-yard touchdown by Stefon Diggs gave Minnesota a 29-24 victory over New Orleans to send the Vikings to the NFC championship game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Christian McCaffrey capped a game-winning, 69-yard drive by running for his second touchdown with 1:07 to play, and the 49ers held on to beat the Green Bay Packers 24-21 in a divisional-round thriller on Saturday night.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Saquon Barkley dashed through the snow for two touchdown runs and finished with 205 yards rushing, Jalen Hurts had a 44-yard scoring run and the Eagles held on against the turnover-happy Rams 28-22 on Sunday to reach the NFC championship game.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Nick Bailey celebrate gardeners throughout the country who have created some truly unique gardens and made every space count. Carol meets a couple in Dorset whose garden is full of inspirational features.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes a special guest, the Duchess of Cornwall, to Longmeadow, where she shares her love of gardening. Nick Bailey visits Knoll Gardens and gives his tips on the tall perennials which give a burst of colour towards the end of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow, enjoying the colours of late summer in the garden. Adam Frost, Carol Klein and Frances Tophill get an exclusive preview of Gardeners' World Live at the NEC.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow with plenty of seasonal advice to keep gardens colourful. Will Young shows off his south London courtyard garden and reveals why it has become an absolute joy in his life, and Joe Swift helps him create some seasonal pot displays for sunny and shady spots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: On Deck
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late."Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Fed by the Mekong River, Tonlé Sap Lake in Cambodia is not only home to hundreds of thousands of people living in the floating villages, it is also the source of 75% of Cambodia’s fish (equal to 60% of the country’s protein intake). Because of a combination of threats, from pollution to climate change, the densely populated area’s fish populations are dwindling – but locals are educating themselves on ways to make change. In this beautifully photographed award-winning film, we get a rare glimpse into life on the lake while learning how a dedicated conservation group is combatting plastic pollution.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: At age seven, Cash “The Conservation Kid” Daniels began leading cleanups along the Tennessee River in his hometown, Chattanooga. Six years later, Cash continues to make a significant impact on the river’s health by strategically collecting fishing waste and inspiring his peers across the world to protect the environment and all the wildlife he holds dear.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Bass fishing takes on numerous forms, from the simplicity of backyard pond fishing to the apex of competitive tournament angling. Yet, within this pursuit lies a distinct niche: trophy hunting via swimbait fishing. Unlike traditional baits, swimbaits stand out in their uniqueness within an angler's arsenal. Ranging from six to twelve-plus inches in length and weighing two to sixteen ounces, these baits require a quiver of specialized equipment and a different mindset. The adage "big bait, big fish" is the guiding principle, firmly centered on catching the biggest bass in the lake, armed with the largest baits from your tackle box.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Fishing with the Mayor Description: Join the Major of destin as he ventures into the world of coastal fishing, leaving the city behind for a day of fun and unexpected challenges. With plenty of laughs and surprising twists, this episode showcases the Mayor in a whole new light.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In this episode of going coastal, Capt. Joshua Calhoon & Marcus Castro set out for epic Tarpon fishing. They got one boat side and then decided to go after giant mangrove snapper for hook & cook at Pepper’s!

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits Key Largo to search out backwater battles with snook, reds, trout and surprises in Florida Bay with Capt. Bruce Davis.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everything—and the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and it’s bigger than ever. This time, we’re in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Florida’s most critical ecosystems. But it’s not just about hard work—it’s about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Don’t miss Part 1—where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of species—including hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacks—leaving Rush thinking, “A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!”

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Ali’s home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma — chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and that’s exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: On Deck
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late."Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Fed by the Mekong River, Tonlé Sap Lake in Cambodia is not only home to hundreds of thousands of people living in the floating villages, it is also the source of 75% of Cambodia’s fish (equal to 60% of the country’s protein intake). Because of a combination of threats, from pollution to climate change, the densely populated area’s fish populations are dwindling – but locals are educating themselves on ways to make change. In this beautifully photographed award-winning film, we get a rare glimpse into life on the lake while learning how a dedicated conservation group is combatting plastic pollution.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: At age seven, Cash “The Conservation Kid” Daniels began leading cleanups along the Tennessee River in his hometown, Chattanooga. Six years later, Cash continues to make a significant impact on the river’s health by strategically collecting fishing waste and inspiring his peers across the world to protect the environment and all the wildlife he holds dear.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Bass fishing takes on numerous forms, from the simplicity of backyard pond fishing to the apex of competitive tournament angling. Yet, within this pursuit lies a distinct niche: trophy hunting via swimbait fishing. Unlike traditional baits, swimbaits stand out in their uniqueness within an angler's arsenal. Ranging from six to twelve-plus inches in length and weighing two to sixteen ounces, these baits require a quiver of specialized equipment and a different mindset. The adage "big bait, big fish" is the guiding principle, firmly centered on catching the biggest bass in the lake, armed with the largest baits from your tackle box.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Fishing with the Mayor Description: Join the Major of destin as he ventures into the world of coastal fishing, leaving the city behind for a day of fun and unexpected challenges. With plenty of laughs and surprising twists, this episode showcases the Mayor in a whole new light.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal

programme.title: Saltwater Underground

programme.title: Saltwater Underground

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everything—and the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and it’s bigger than ever. This time, we’re in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Florida’s most critical ecosystems. But it’s not just about hard work—it’s about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Don’t miss Part 1—where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of species—including hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacks—leaving Rush thinking, “A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!”

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Ali’s home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma — chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and that’s exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Big Girls Don't Cry...They Get Even

programme.desc: Two sanitation workers and diehard wrestling fans watch their idol suffer a career-ending defeat and travel to Atlanta to mastermind his comeback.

programme.title: The Majestic
programme.desc: Upon getting into a car accident, a Hollywood screenwriter develops amnesia and ends up in a small town, where he is mistaken for a missing war hero.

programme.title: Osmosis Jones
programme.desc: Inside the body of a zoo worker, a white-blood-cell cop and a cold tablet join forces to stop a virulent virus that’s intent on taking over The City.

programme.title: Suburban Commando

programme.title: Vision Quest
programme.desc: A gentle but driven 18-year-old underdog toils against the odds to become Washington state’s top wrestler while winning the heart of a young drifter.

programme.title: Midnight Cabaret
programme.desc: An actress's ideal role turns into a nightmare after she becomes the prime suspect in a series of murders.

programme.title: Dark City
programme.desc: A man wanted for murder realizes that everything he believes about himself is a lie and is the creation of a group known as "The Strangers."

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Neurotic conman Roy and his protégé Frank find their latest scam disrupted when Roy discovers he has a teen daughter who wants to meet him.

programme.title: Mama's Boy
programme.desc: The life of an arrogant pseudo-intellectual living at home in Texas with his angelic mom is threatened when she falls in love with a self-help guru.

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: To win a woman’s heart, Dylan kidnaps her dog with a plan to “find” him but a jealous ex, a missing ring and Neil Diamond throw a wrench in the works.

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Six young urbanites with budding careers and restless hearts share their dreams, their music, and the common courtyard between their apartments.

programme.title: Mr. Troop Mom
programme.desc: Looking to reconnect with his daughter, a career-focused dad becomes a fish out of water when he elects to chaperone her scout troop's camping trip.

programme.title: Joe Versus the Volcano
programme.desc: A corporate drone receives life-altering news, and agrees to a tycoon’s odd request to travel halfway around the world and jump into a volcano.

programme.title: The Hudsucker Proxy
programme.desc: When the founder of a large corporation suddenly dies, the board conspires to tank the stock price by installing a lowly mailroom clerk as president.

programme.title: Surf Ninjas
programme.desc: Two surfer dudes discover they are princes of a small South Pacific island and are destined to save their native land from a cruel despot.

programme.title: Mr. Nanny
programme.desc: A retired wrestler must survive an impossible job when becomes the nanny to kids whose favorite game is finding ways to force their nanny to quit.

programme.title: Felon
programme.desc: A suburban family man is convicted of manslaughter and sent to prison, where he becomes caught up in the vicious cycle of corruption and violence.

programme.title: Toy Soldiers
programme.desc: The teen action classic about a group of troublesome students from an exclusive prep school who defend it when Colombian terrorists lay siege to it.

programme.title: The Waterdance
programme.desc: Injured in a climbing accident, writer Joel Garcia (Eric Stoltz) wakes up in a hospital having lost the use of his legs. Soon after, he's placed in a recovery ward where he begins the arduous process of rehabilitation and meets others with injuries like his own. Raymond (Wesley Snipes) is a ladies' man whose girl has nevertheless split, and Bloss (William Forsythe) is a rather prejudiced biker. Together, this unlikely trio helps one another to overcome the greatest challenge of their lives.

programme.title: Calendar Girl
programme.desc: It's 1962 and three friends just out of high school journey to Hollywood determined to meet the object of their shared obsession: Marilyn Monroe.

programme.title: Punchline
programme.desc: Steve, a broke stand-up comedian, develops a friendship and mentorship with Lilah, a homemaker with an ambition to be a stand-up comedian.

programme.title: Nothing in Common
programme.desc: A hilarious comedy about a perpetual adolescent who's forced to deal with his aging, unloving father when his mother leaves him flat.

programme.title: Mortal Thoughts
programme.desc: A low-key thriller revolving around two women, their friendship ringing true and their ill-considered decisions made believable by desperation.

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: A young public relations exec goes on a remarkably disastrous blind date that threatens to upend his entire life while opening him up to true love.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: After bounty hunter Milo learns that his next target is his ex-wife Nicole, the two become entangled in a contentious web of games.

programme.title: Untraceable
programme.desc: There has never been a cyber criminal they couldn't catch...until now...The more people who watch...the faster the victims die.

programme.title: Suspect
programme.desc: Kathleen is an overworked public defender who needs a vacation. Instead, she is given another case with no ordinary crime and no ordinary criminal.

programme.title: Home Invasion
programme.desc: A botched robbery turns into a hostage crisis as a gang of armed criminals holds a woman and four children captive while police surround the house.

programme.title: The Deal
programme.desc: After losing her husband and daughter in a terrible fire, an American woman living in Spain investigates a dangerous mystery surrounding their deaths.

programme.title: The Marine 6: Close Quarters
programme.desc: Jake Carter and another former Marine, Luke Trapper, join forces to rescue a kidnapped girl from a gang of international criminals.

programme.title: Maximum Risk
programme.desc: A police officer and his twin brother's fiancée team up to expose an international conspiracy in this erotic, globe-hopping adventure.

programme.title: The Lazarus Project
programme.desc: A reformed thief is drawn back into a burglary-gone-wrong that lands him on death row, until he mysteriously wakes up in a psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: U-Turn
programme.desc: A criminal looking to pay off his debts meets a couple in Arizona who hope to use him to settle their personal vendettas, even if it involves murder.

programme.title: Cowboy Up
programme.desc: Follow the tumultuous life of two brothers, Ely, a rising rodeo star, and Hank, a rodeo clown, as they make their way through the bull riding circuit.

programme.title: Bad Country
programme.desc: Set in 1983, this is the tale of a Baton Rouge detective who uses an informant to infiltrate the most sinister criminal enterprise in the South.

programme.title: Into Thin Air: Death on Everest
programme.desc: The compelling and dramatic true story of two teams of hikers as they made their dangerous and fatal ascent on Mt. Everest in early 1996.

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: Don't Knock the Twist
programme.desc: Dancers prepare for a TV special on the twist in this musical featuring performances of chart-topping hits from the heyday of rock 'n' roll.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf Takes a Chance
programme.desc: A former jewel thief (Warren William) is accused of murder after betting the police inspector that he can stay out of trouble for 24 hours.

programme.title: Adam Had Four Sons
programme.desc: A French governess becomes the center of a wealthy New York family with four boys after it suffers the losses of its matriarch, business and estate.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: Baby the Rain Must Fall
programme.desc: After his release from prison, an aspiring country singer tries to go straight, but his dream of a singing career puts this plan in danger.

programme.title: Cover Girl
programme.desc: John Coudair (Otto Kruger) was wounded long ago when his fiancée called off their engagement, and when he spots the woman's granddaughter, comely stage performer Rusty Parker (Rita Hayworth), he's reminded of what he lost. A publishing mogul, he decides to put the naive young beauty on the cover of his magazine. Although he might lose her, Rusty's boyfriend, Danny McGuire (Gene Kelly), refuses to interfere with her path to success. Ultimately, she must decide between riches and romance.

programme.title: Drive a Crooked Road
programme.desc: Auto mechanic Mickey must give up his dream of becoming a professional race car driver after he is fooled into being a chump for some gangsters.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finacé, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: In the French Style
programme.desc: A young American travels to Paris to become an artist. Swept up in a series of affairs, she must decide whether to stay or return home to get married.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: This steamy pot-boiler follows the intrigues surrounding an escaped convict who attempts to return to the small southern town where he grew up.

programme.title: Doctor Faustus
programme.desc: Frustrated with the limits of his knowledge, Dr. Faustus calls upon Lucifer and offers his soul in return for 24 years of hedonism and invincibility.

programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: Adam Had Four Sons
programme.desc: A French governess becomes the center of a wealthy New York family with four boys after it suffers the losses of its matriarch, business and estate.

programme.desc: After his release from prison, an aspiring country singer tries to go straight, but his dream of a singing career puts this plan in danger.

programme.title: Cover Girl
programme.desc: John Coudair (Otto Kruger) was wounded long ago when his fiancée called off their engagement, and when he spots the woman's granddaughter, comely stage performer Rusty Parker (Rita Hayworth), he's reminded of what he lost. A publishing mogul, he decides to put the naive young beauty on the cover of his magazine. Although he might lose her, Rusty's boyfriend, Danny McGuire (Gene Kelly), refuses to interfere with her path to success. Ultimately, she must decide between riches and romance.

programme.title: Drive a Crooked Road
programme.desc: Auto mechanic Mickey must give up his dream of becoming a professional race car driver after he is fooled into being a chump for some gangsters.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finacé, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: Utah Blaine
programme.desc: A gunfighter helps a ranch owner in his attempt to prevent a renegade crew from taking over the territory.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Renegades
programme.desc: Hannah Brockway (Evelyn Keyes) has a perfect fiancé in Dr. Sam Martin (Willard Parker). Sam, who is respected by Hannah's family, is a noble man who cares for her and can make a good living in their frontier town. Yet Hannah craves adventure and finds it when she meets dashing Ben Dembrow (Larry Parks), the youngest of a notorious crime family. Together Ben and Hannah set off to forge a new life, but prejudice and strangling family ties soon bring trouble to these newlyweds.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Riders of the Badlands
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger's uncanny resemblance to a wanted outlaw results in his own arrest by a fellow lawman.

programme.title: Stage to Tucson
programme.desc: Trouble-shooters (Rod Cameron, Wayne Morris) track Arizona stagecoaches hijacked for sale to the Confederacy.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: Go West, Young Girl!
programme.desc: New England writer Netty (Karen Valentine) and cavalry widow Gilda (Sandra Will) team up to find Billy the Kid.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: The Last Posse
programme.desc: To settle an old score, a father and his sons rob a cattle-swindling rancher, go into hiding, and soon find a posse of townsfolk after them.

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: Journeying from Mexico back home to West Texas, mercenary Tom Buchanan (Randolph Scott) takes a break for the night in the border town of Agry. He soon discovers that almost every resident -- from the crooked sheriff (Barry Kelley) to the shifty-eyed innkeeper -- is a member of the prominent Agry family. When Buchanan defends Juan de la Vega (Manuel Rojas), a young man about to be lynched for shooting the town drunk, he himself is accused of murder and must struggle to escape town alive.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Cowboy Star
programme.desc: A disenchanted movie cowboy proves to be a genuine hero when he's forced to shoot it out with a gang of desperadoes.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: Hollywood Round-Up
programme.desc: Kindly, fading star Carol Stevens (Helen Twelvetrees) accepts a role in a two-bit Western movie and arrives for an on-location shoot in a small town. When Stevens has words with her pompous co-star, Grant Drexel (Grant Withers), Drexel's stuntman, Buck Kennedy (Buck Jones), steps in to defend her. Kennedy's honorable gesture costs him his job. After a group of gangsters posing as a film crew frames the newly unemployed Kennedy for the robbery of a local bank, he must struggle to clear his name.

programme.title: Snake River Desperadoes
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) squares off against men who are trying to ignite a war between whites and American Indians.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter crossing the Arizona desert routs a band of marauding Apaches and rescues the young survivor of a massacre.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's Christmas and new detective Charlie Nelson moves into Midsomer. He's thrown straight into an intriguing mystery in the village of Morton Shallows. A man is fatally stabbed with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a "haunted" manor house. Can Barnaby and Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder and trap the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of murders in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day "sinners". But who is responsible and why?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is covered in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads to restaurant Wyvern House and its tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron. Secrets from the past surface and the killer strikes again - but the poison spreads wider than its intended target.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a body is discovered in a reservoir dropped out of a plane, Barnaby and Nelson find the world of stunt pilots and military heroes hides many dark secrets. Are campaigners against the local airfield behind Bernard King's murder or does it link back to a tragic story from World War Two?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the boss of Calder's Biscuit Company is murdered in Copenhagen, Barnaby and Nelson join forces with two female Danish detectives, the abrasive and astute Poulsen and the charming and cool Degn. They discover Eric Calder had more linking him to Copenhagen than just his famous Golden Clusters.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The ghost village of Little Auburn has been abandoned since the war. When a young man is found murdered during its grand reopening, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter must unravel a sinister web of lies from both past and present in order to catch the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Bleakridge Watch patrols the streets of their remote village, exposing anyone who steps outside the law. When one of their members dies, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter uncover just how far some people will go for power...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Tensions run high in Lower Pampling as a new type of cricket threatens a century of tradition. When a star cricketer dies during a tournament, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter's investigation draws them into a dangerous game with a surprise visitor from Barnaby's past...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Winter discover a dead body covered in live rabbits it reveals a sinister side to the local pet show. Is this a rivalry taken too far or is the killer driven by something darker?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young girl slips away from a Jane Austen weekend dressed in period attire, and is found stabbed in the woods, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter need to look back in time to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the annual Thassingham Classical Music Festival draws in big audiences, several musicians anxiously compete for the coveted Falconer Bursary Award. When the winner is brutally murdered and a priceless violin stolen, Barnaby and Winter's investigations lead them deep into a world haunted by a potentially deadly curse.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths amongst an aristocratic family. In the midst of a Civil War re-enactment the family relive their own historic battles with their hostile neighbours. But what is the truth about the DeQuettevilles - and the ghostly rider?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Grady has just returned to the village where he committed the murder years ago amid much anger from locals. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomer's own Stella Harris. When Stella's more famous sister returns after a 40-year family rift, the killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot. Is life - and death - imitating art?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, amateur astronomer Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. Barnaby and Jones soon discover intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the star-seeking community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Harriet Farmer wakes up after being in a coma since the night she tried to elope. Soon afterwards, a killer strikes members of a chess club. Could the attack which left Harriet for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. Secret and controversial plans to modernise the dairy are revealed while rumours about private lives of the parents cause a row at the prestigious local prep school. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer is buzzing with excitement at the arrival of the annual ‘Paramount Dance Extravaganza’. But behind the sequins and smiles are deep running feuds and passions.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Prolific real estate agent Alexander Beauvoisin is murdered in front of a crowd at the unveiling of a new dolls house collection at Midsomer Museum of the family.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Deddington’s thriving bee Empire has put Granville Norton on the map, but what lengths will they go to to ensure they’re never dethroned…

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.desc: As the Barrett-Jackson Auction gets into full swing, the auction block sees a surge of American Made cars. Everything from Chevy Corvettes to Ford Mustang Mach 1s, and even a 1927 Ford Model-T Popcorn Truck cross the auction block!

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's Lamborghini versus everyone in Scottsdale, Ariz.; The World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions once again feature some of the most scintillating vehicles ever sold, including a Lamborghini Diablo owned by Danny Koker.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The bidding heats up as everything from race cars to retro people movers and convertibles to classics cross the block in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Highlighting the best of the best when it comes to classics from vintage Broncos and Chevy Blazers to Corvettes, GTO's, Austin Healys and Volkswagon buses.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP

programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi uncover a sweet locker in Santa Ana, Calif.; Mary looks for something more collectible; Darrell's find may equal another big win for the Gambler.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a road trip to Liberty University where they will drop off John Luke and Mary Kate for their first year of college. Along the way, they stop in Nashville to visit Willie's friend Colt Ford.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family throws a party for Willie & Korie's 25th anniversary, but things take a dramatic turn when Willie and Korie reveal a big secret. Meanwhile, when Jase blames Uncle Si for getting him a parking ticket.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie asks a local chainsaw artist to make him a statue, he gets a big surprise when it's revealed that the statue is of an unlikely subject -- Willie himself. Meanwhile, Jep and Jessica attempt to help Kay with her hoarding.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: On a trip to New York, Jase's son Reed proposes to his girlfriend, which inspires his father to fan the flames of romance back home with Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The tables are turned when the HOA comes to Jase for help to rid the neighborhood of a menacing beaver.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and Jep get into an argument over which of them is the rightful heir to their grandfather's old rifle, they decide to settle the argument with a marksmanship contest.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Si has started moonlighting as a grocery bagger, the guys show up at the store and their teasing inadvertently causes Si to lose his job and his chance to enter a local bagging competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a large storm hits Monroe, most of the adults head to Phil and Kay's to help protect their house from flooding while Jess, Sadie, Rebecca and Cole babysit the kids.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie accompanies Kay to a local bingo tournament and gets seduced by the game, eventually embarrassing himself and Kay with his enthusiasm.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie takes Sadie on a tour of a local college in hopes of convincing her to stay nearby after her impending high school graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertson brothers debate which of their wives makes the best cornbread, it escalates into a full-on cornbread cook off. Meanwhile, when Jep, Martin, and Godwin play a practical joke on Uncle Si.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a one-day rodeo fantasy camp where they learn the ins and outs of riding, roping and clowning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After leaving school to pursue music, Jase feels that Reed needs some structure in his life, so he hires him to take his place at Duck Commander.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase accompanies Willie on a business trip to Arkansas to pitch a new product and has unorthodox sales strategies. Back in Monroe, Jep and Si have to track down an important item of Willie's that they accidentally shipped out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie thinks his kids have been spending too much time on their phones and other devices so he initiates a "No-Tech Week," but when he has to participate too it ends up being harder than he thought.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie, Korie, Jase and Missy take dance lessons from Sadie to prepare for Reed and Rebecca's upcoming weddings. Jase's plan to perform Reed's wedding ceremony may fall through when he waits until the last minute to renew his ordainment.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Colorado bondsman Bobby Brown's got trouble and his name is Jackson. Weighing in at over 240lbs and standing six foot tall this bad boy has skipped out on a $10,000 bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With twelve kids of his own Dog knows how hard it is to keep children on the straight and narrow, especially during their turbulent teens.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A one-hour special that looks back at 2006, one of Dog's most tumultuous years, which has included the passing of Beth's father, Dog and Beth's wedding, the tragic death of Dog's daughter Barbara, and the sudden arrest of Dog, Tim, and Leland.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's latest fugitive, doesn't think small when it comes to illegal drugs: he was carrying almost a pound of methamphetamine when he was arrested. Now he's on the run with his pregnant girlfriend on the high plains of Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog is back in Hawaii confronted with two alleged felons who are in crisis. Family and friends of these bondees are convinced that they are getting into further trouble while awaiting trial.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team fight the war on ice - crystal methamphetamine - on many fronts. They appear on a special anti-drug float in a parade. Then they go after bail-jumping Pana, a convicted drug dealer.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Christopher is barely 21, already has history of domestic abuse and assault, and now he's facing major time in a room without a view. This hunt won't be easy for Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog and the Posse for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A defense lawyer-turned-divorce attorney is in a tense situation when she’s asked to represent her best friend’s husband who allegedly killed her.

programme.title: Murdered at 17
programme.desc: Brooke Emerson discovers a kindred spirit in Jake Campali, but she soon discovers he's the boyfriend from hell. Jake manipulates and controls her, eventually framing her for murder.

programme.title: Poisoned Love: The Stacey Castor Story
programme.desc: Stacey Ruth Castor weathered the storm of her first husband's death and managed to find love again with her boss, David. But when David is discovered dead of an apparent suicide, the police suspect some foul play, as David's death mimics that of Stacey's first husband, Michael Wallace, who died in 2000.

programme.desc: Yoga instructor Kaitlin Armstrong vanishes into thin air after she's accused of killing professional cyclist Moriah Wilson in a jealous rage. On the run, Armstrong tries to alter her appearance as authorities launch a manhunt to track her down.
